summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about conquering the giants in our lives! PT delivered a powerful sermon centered on the biblical story of David and Goliath, but with a modern twist that speaks directly to our daily struggles. Using the narrative of David facing the seemingly insurmountable giant, Pastor Travis breaks down how we can overcome our own life 'giants' through faith, perspective, and trust in God. He powerfully reminds us that our giants - whether they're relational, emotional, or medical - are no match for our mighty God. The most profound takeaway? Jesus is always bigger than our giants! Pastor Travis challenges us to walk by faith, not by sight, and to remember that God has brought us through challenges before and will continue to do so. His passionate delivery and personal stories make this message not just a sermon, but a battle cry for believers facing their own Goliaths. Can you imagine being so confident in God that even a 9-foot-tall giant doesn't intimidate you? That's the kind of radical faith PT is calling us to embrace!
mainPoints: Walk by faith and not by sight
Only listen to the voice of God

versesMentioned.text: David said, 'Who is this uncircumcised Philistine that he should defy the armies of the living God?'
For we live by faith, not by sight.
The Lord will fight for you; you need only to be still.
Do not be afraid of them, for the Lord your God will fight for you.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 46:1: 'God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.'
Monday.action: Make a list of current challenges. Next to each challenge, write down a way God might be speaking to you through it.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see my challenges through Your eyes. Give me the courage to face my giants with faith and not fear. Reveal Your strength in my weakness. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Tuesday.action: Choose one challenge and intentionally reframe it from a perspective of faith. What would trusting God look like in this situation?
Tuesday.prayer: Father, transform my thinking. Help me replace fear with faith. Show me how to view my challenges through Your lens of victory. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Isaiah 41:10: 'So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.'
Wednesday.action: Write down three past challenges God has already helped you overcome. Reflect on His faithfulness.
Wednesday.prayer: God, thank You for Your constant protection. Remind me of Your past faithfulness when I feel overwhelmed. Fill me with courage and trust. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 8:31: 'If God is for us, who can be against us?'
Thursday.focus: Recognizing God's power over our giants
Thursday.action: Practice speaking scripture over your challenges. When fear rises, counter it with a faith-filled declaration.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, teach me to speak Your truth over my circumstances. Help me remember that You are always greater than any challenge I face. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Chronicles 20:15: 'Do not be afraid or discouraged because of this vast army. For the battle is not yours, but God's.'
Friday.action: Spend time in prayer, literally handing over each of your challenges to God. Visualize laying them at His feet.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my giants to You. I trust that You are fighting on my behalf. Give me peace that surpasses understanding. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 1 John 4:4: 'You, dear children, are from God and have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.'
Saturday.action: Do something bold that demonstrates faith over fear. Step out of your comfort zone, trusting God's guidance.
Saturday.prayer: God, fill me with Your courage. Help me live today not in fear, but in the confident assurance of Your power working through me. Amen.
